fields.summary: Instance Metadata Not Available for custom VPC

comments.body:
Whats confusing here is that we have a ticket open to support custom routes in VPC - EUCA-11571, however it looks like this should work based upon the information seen in midonet.

For additional information, here is the SSH attempt with more verbosity:
{code}
[root@h-02 ~]# ssh -vvv -i devops-admin-pk ubuntu@10.116.155.223
OpenSSH_5.3p1, OpenSSL 1.0.1e-fips 11 Feb 2013
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: Applying options for *
debug2: ssh_connect: needpriv 0
debug1: Connecting to 10.116.155.223 [10.116.155.223] port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: permanently_set_uid: 0/0
debug3: Not a RSA1 key file devops-admin-pk.
debug2: key_type_from_name: unknown key type '-----BEGIN'
debug3: key_read: missing keytype

debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version OpenSSH_6.6.1p1 Ubuntu-2ubuntu2.3
debug1: match: OpenSSH_6.6.1p1 Ubuntu-2ubuntu2.3 pat OpenSSH*
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0

debug3: Wrote 960 bytes for a total of 981
Read from socket failed: Connection reset by peer
{code}
Attached AWS VPC sample template used as a reference for the template used to create this issue.

*Update*

[Using 'us-east-1' region on federated environment in QA|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/QA+Shared+Setups#QASharedSetups-FederatedSetup], this template deployed successfully a couple of times.  However, after testing a few more times, this issue returned.

Problem manifests in 4.3 code, with the addition of ENI meta-data.
eucalyptus meta-data server currently returns 404 for requests to meta-data/network/interfaces/macs/xxxx/local-hostname from instances in VPCs with DNS hostnames = false. cloud-init fails because of it, and sshd is not started.

Workaround: create VPCs with DNS hostnames = true

Verified by internal ELB use-case. 
Internal ELB uses VMs in a non-default VPC with custom routes. The VPC has dns-hostname set to false. Inside the VM, ELB script uses metadata.
